definition: musical ensemble of several instruments (e.g. duet 二重奏 or trio 三重奏)
to play music/to achieve/to present a memorial to the emperor (old)

sentences.english: We harbour ambitions of putting together a group for the Mendelssohn Octet.
sentences.chinese: 我们还梦想着再找来些人一起演奏门德尔松的八重奏。

sentences.english: The first item on the program is woodwind quintet.
sentences.chinese: 节目单上的第一个节目是木管五重奏。

sentences.english: "Duets II" celebrates his eighty-fifth on August third.
sentences.chinese: “二重奏II”庆祝他在八月第三第八十五。

sentences.english: String Quartet in A minor, Op. 41, No. 1
sentences.chinese: a小调弦乐四重奏，作品41，第一首。

sentences.english: A ferocious blast (ff) starts off the reprise.
sentences.chinese: 重奏在一记爆破般的响声中开始。

sentences.english: The string quartet was calling, and anyway it would have been bad manners.
sentences.chinese: 弦乐四重奏在召唤，缺席怎么说都太失礼了。

sentences.english: Quartet for Flute, Oboe, Cello and Harpsichord.
sentences.chinese: 长笛四重奏，双簧管，大提琴和大键琴。

sentences.english: Beethoven String Quartet, Op. 18, No. 2, final Movement.
sentences.chinese: 贝多芬弦乐四重奏，作品18号，第二首，末乐章。

sentences.english: But, one day I would like to take a trio or quartet on the road with me.
sentences.chinese: 但总有一天我要在巡演上来个三重奏，或四重奏。

sentences.english: But, one day I would like to take a trio or quartet on the road with me.
sentences.chinese: 但总有一天我要在巡演上来个三重奏，或四重奏。

sentences.english: Transcription of String Quartet No. 1, for orchestra.
sentences.chinese: 为管弦乐队而改编的第1弦乐四重奏。

sentences.english: Journey back into Beethoven's mind with the Borromeo String Quartet.
sentences.chinese: 博罗美奥弦乐四重奏将会为我们进行贝多芬解码。

sentences.english: Schumann made two principal demands of the prospective composer of string quartets.
sentences.chinese: 舒曼提出了两个主要要求准作曲家的弦乐四重奏。

sentences.english: Soon the duet will become a trio.
sentences.chinese: 很快地二重奏形成了三重唱。

sentences.english: Certainly people can take my part in the string quartet.
sentences.chinese: 显然有人能在管弦乐四重奏里代替我演奏的。

sentences.english: Bassoon Quartet in F major, Op. 1, No. 2
sentences.chinese: 大调巴松四重奏，作品第1号，第二首。

definition: to perform on a musical instrument
double reed wind instrument (such as oboe or bassoon)
part (in multi-part instrumental or choral music), such as the soprano part or bass part
